attributes.action: Stop Greenbelt development in Send, Send Marsh & Burnt Common, Surrey
attributes.additional_details:
We object in the strongest possible terms to the Council’s stance on the declassification of large areas of Green Belt in and around the borough and, in particular, the proposed 2,200-odd houses earmarked for Send and Send Marsh.

Our primary reasons are as follows:-

●	it will result in urban sprawl which is precisely what establishment of the Green Belt was designed to protect

●	there is insufficient infrastructure to support such massive development

●	local schools are at capacity now

●	roads are at a standstill at peak times already and building on this scale will add hundreds more vehicles

●	the villages of Send, Send Marsh, Burnt Common will completely lose their identities

●	there are problems of flooding at the proposed site next to Aldertons

Contrary to what a few Borough and Parish councillors have been suggesting at various local meetings, the groundswell of local residents’ opinion is totally against the loss of Green Belt.
